meanings.definition: To deny any claim or connection to something.
meanings.sent1: She quickly disclaimed any involvement in the prank.
meanings.sent2: The company disclaims all liability for damages caused by misuse of their product.
meanings.sent3: John tried to disclaim responsibility for the broken vase, but his guilty expression gave him away.
meanings.sent4: The politician's speech seemed to disclaim any association with the controversial policy.
meanings.sent5: The detective disclaimed any knowledge of the missing evidence, raising suspicions.

meanings.definition: To renounce or reject any responsibility or ownership.
meanings.sent1: The suspect decided to disclaim any involvement in the crime.
meanings.sent2: As a witness, you cannot disclaim your duty to tell the truth in court.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to disclaim responsibility for knocking over the vase by pretending to be asleep.
meanings.sent4: The artist's unique style seemed to disclaim traditional techniques.
meanings.sent5: The captain disclaimed any knowledge of the mysterious cargo on board the ship.

meanings.definition: To make a disclaimer or statement denying responsibility.
meanings.sent1: Before the game, the coach had to disclaim any knowledge of the opposing team's strategy.
meanings.sent2: The company's website clearly disclaims any errors in the information provided.
meanings.sent3: The comedian disclaimed any responsibility for the audience's laughter, claiming it was all their own doing.
meanings.sent4: The author's preface disclaimed any intention to offend readers with differing opinions.
meanings.sent5: The teacher disclaimed any favoritism by treating all students equally.
